rComments: I honestly do not understand the bad reviews. I currently have Prof Alvo for MAT2375 and the midterm was extremely fair if you had listened in class and done the suggested practice questions. Also, he explains very complex subjects in an effective and simple manner. He does a lot of examples in class, which is extremely appreciated!

Despite the negative reviews for this prof I decided to take this class last fall and I absolutely loved it. The online format he used was a bit tough but his explanations were easy to understand and straightforward. It was easy to do well in this class with not too much work.

If you like learning an advanced math class on your own, waisting time in class watching pre-recorded vids that are already posted and getting DESTROYED on exams then this is the class for you! I cannot express how much I regret taking this class. Please don't take this class if you need an elective. Save your $ and time and take something else....
teacherRatingTags: ['Lots of homework', 'Graded by few things', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: This is my first time to rate a professor, and thx Mayer give me this chance. He try to be a nice prof, but hes not. He doesnt care his student, and he doesnt even know how to teach! Avoid him at all cost!

I took this course as a upper year sci elective thinking I would get a good grade. It was quite challenging as a non-math major student. The lectures explain topics at a surface level but the exam questions require more application. Get ready to study on your own as the prof is not very helpful... if I could go back, I would not choose this course.

He 's a very bad prof. He played pre-recorded lectures during live sessions and thought that this would be a brilliant idea. In the pre-recorded lectures, all he did was read something off a paper. Also his final was worth 19 marks but 60 % of the overall grade. Basically, you lose a lot of points and you have to study everything by yourself.

I enjoyed students' memes abt him on Fb gc but I didn't enjoy his midterms or finals. It's only out of like 15 or so and he ALWAYS made a mistake in his midterm so he took one question out. I could have gotten A+ if I answered just one more question right. Also I had to teach eveything by myself. Reading the lecture notes didn't help me at all.

My first time to rate a prof, and I'm about to graduate. my opinion is, he's a good prof in terms of testing your knowledge, but not a good prof for teaching and getting a good grade. I suggest you pick another prof for the same course.

Avoid this prof/ course if you can. Maybe it would have been better in person, but his online pre-recorded lectures were just him reading off the equations in the notes. Does not know how to use technology and played his pre-recorded lectures during the synchronous lecture time which was useless. You'll end up teaching yourself the whole course.

By far one of the most frustrating classes that I have ever taken in my four years at uOttawa. Dr. Alvo does nothing but read out pre-written math during lectures, and his lectures and assignment questions are riddled with errors. Dr. Alvo replies quickly to emails but his answers often don't answer the question asked. In short, a frustrating class
teacherRatingTags: ['Test heavy', 'Graded by few things', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Chooose this professor. just come review session before midterm and final, you will get good grade since everything that he talked in review class will be included in midterm and final. Most important, professor will improve you final grade if you didnt do well in final.

This class was so easy. You can get straight A if you try to attend every class and take notes. All exams are MC and midterm was super easy. Final wad fine. I won't say he is the greatest prof, but he wasn't that bad. i enjoyed solving problems with him in class.

Honestly thought biostats with him would be worse but he's actually a nice prof who seems to be hated for teaching a dull subject. Definitely take good notes in class and you'll find that the concepts aren't too hard (read them alongside the pdfs and/or textbook). Sometimes he confuses himself but he makes it up with an easy m/c midterm

The best professor I've ever had. He is very fond of his subject, and he recognizes a devoted student. Tough grader but only because his level of knowledge is so much beyond our modest ability. I've taken 3 different courses with Professor Alvo and would take more.

Great prof. Would take another class with him. He follows the textbook very closely and if you do the practice problems from the book you'll do fine. He doesn't ask trick questions. I appreciated his focus on application instead of proofs since that is more relevant to my program. He has dry jokes that are still funny. Answers emails quickly.

To Be honest the comments are pretty accurate. He is not a BAD prof but not the best. You will need to work HARD. Study the book but focus on his notes. Practice a lot of the review questions and quizzes that he posts and you should have 70% or more. Tests are hard but doable. Study after each class or good Luck. But definetly not an easy class.
Good luck

Mayer, Mayer, Mayer. I would recommend you look for other teachers before choosing Mr. Alvo. ALL questions on Midterm/Final are multiple choice A to E (Good luck guessing). Replies emails with 1 or 2 words.. 3 if you are lucky. Makes midterms extremely long and painful. Willing to take final mark as 100% of grade if better than midterm 1 & 2.. +1
good luck and may the force be with all who take his class
he's not a very good lecturer. I got an A by using youtube for the first half of the course (Probability) and self teaching myself the second half (Statistics).

WORST PROFESSOR I EVER HAD!!! His homework and assignments are not reflected in the exams he makes, and his material taught in class is not remotely covered in the exams. The statistics material is not that bad, but this prof makes it nearly impossible to pass with a good grade. if you have the chance, RUN.
do not take his course!!!
Avoid!
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Lots of homework', 'Tough grader']

rComments: The  final exam was exceptionally brutal. No matter how much you read and do practice questions be prepared to face questions you'd never expect for the final. Questions are nothing like the assignment problems he gives. He does not have any previous year papers online and neither does he give a sample exam. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Lots of homework', 'Tough grader']

rComments: In over 5 years of post secondary education, one of the worst professors I have come across. Take my advice, switch to another professor. If you decide to disregard this advice, then make sure to sit in the front row, his writing is small. Take stellar notes. Get a tutor. Fail the final exam and enroll again with a different Professor.
Horrible final exam, nothing was covered in the lectures that appeared on final exam, expected to come out with A+ from this course, now hoping just to pass
Hardest course I've ever taken. Exams didn't reflect what was taught at all. However, he's a funny guy with great jokes! (Jokes don't get you a good GPA though...)
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', 'Get ready to read', 'Lots of homework']

rComments: He'll smile, joke, pretend to be your friend, then hit you with exams that you can't do no matter how smart you are or how much you study bc 14 to 13 of the points are for: a) material you didn't see, b) questions missing info or worded so they don't parse.  In 4 years of math at UO, his was the only exam that was objectively unfair.  STAY AWAY!!

Everybody is correct. The midterm was decent, more or less what I expected. HOWEVER, the exam was ABSOLUTELY NOTHING LEARNED IN CLASS! TERRIBLE TEACHER! IF YOU HAVE HIM GET OUT!!!! He does not help, sends one word answers via e-mail and does not care for his students. Takes nothing into consideration, and does not help you out whatsoever. HE IS BAD

This class is a first year stats class and it should be really easy, or a little bit time consuming if you don't have a math background. Midterm was easy and the course content was easy and then the final was completely different from everything, it was almost impossible.

Midterm & exam were both absolutely brutal. Started the lecture by telling us that half the class failed the midterm and then started the lecture right away. He showed no concern whatsoever! He is also a completely unreasonable marker and will give you 0 points on a question if he feels you weren't "headed in the right direction". Avoid if you can!

This professor has no ability to teach.  The textbook provides no illustrative examples and the answers to assignments do not show the steps used to arrive at answer.  Very poor atmosphere for learning, especially for students that are math challenged.  I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS COURSE WITH THIS PROFESSOR.

Nice personality, average lecturer, completely unreasonable exams; level of difficulty does not reflect lectures and assignments.  Does not give part marks; show that you know stuff but get the wrong final answer and get 0. Average on midterm was a failing grade and he did not curve it. Just wrote the final exam and I don't want to think about it.

This class is very easy, but I do not recommend if you don't need to take it. The DGD is useless. Don't buy Minitab, Excel works just as well. And plus it doesn't work for macs anyway. He is very nice but boring. The TA is super smart, to the point where she can't explain things because she just assumes we get it. Make friends in class, it helps.

His lectures consist of doing solved problems from the book - this is very offensive (as if grad students cannt read the book) but his tests will take you down (nothing similar to  lectures or assignments).  Be careful and try to avoid this guy at any cost!  You will suffer a lot, learn very little and get a bad mark.
Tabarnak! :(

Be consistent with your level of difficulty in questions.  Giving a moderate midterm, easy assignments and then giving all questions in the final exam a level of harder than average is not appropiate.
Alvo is a very nice man. Good prof.
midterm and final were killers!!!
good teacher !
No Comments
